content.raw:
Thanks for pointing this out!

I think `ignition-tools` support on Windows is currently considered lower priority than sdformat and Gazebo, so I might have to get back to that later.

It looks like the fix will be creating a function to wrap `popen` alongside whatever the Windows equivalent is. I'll have to do some research on what Windows provides that's comparable to `popen`.

As a stopgap measure, what if we always disable that test on Windows? We can reenable and fix it once we're ready to support `ignition-tools` on Windows.
content.html:
Thanks for pointing this out!

I think ignition-tools support on Windows is currently considered lower priority than sdformat and Gazebo, so I might have to get back to that later.

It looks like the fix will be creating a function to wrap popen alongside whatever the Windows equivalent is. I'll have to do some research on what Windows provides that's comparable to popen.

As a stopgap measure, what if we always disable that test on Windows? We can reenable and fix it once we're ready to support ignition-tools on Windows.
